summary: This bill, the Countering Russian Innovation and Safeguarding Individual Scientists Act of 2025 (CRISIS Act of 2025), authorizes the Secretary of Homeland Security to grant special immigrant status to certain Russian nationals. Eligible individuals must have a doctoral degree in STEM fields and be seeking to work in the United States in those fields. This act sets numerical limitations (3,000 per fiscal year for 2026-2029), establishes vetting requirements and requires record-keeping. The authority to admit immigrants under this act will terminate at the end of the fourth full fiscal year after enactment.
